intro: Christella megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf christella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage. The plant features dense, compact growth with leathery, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green. Its showy, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in late spring to early summer. Christella megaphylla thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
